info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 12 at 10:53AM EDT until June 12 at 12:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM EDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL CHESTERFIELD...SOUTHEASTERN GOOCHLAND...HENRICO... SOUTHEASTERN HANOVER...WEST CENTRAL KING WILLIAM AND EAST CENTRAL POWHATAN COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF RICHMOND... At 1053 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Glen Allen to near Bon Air, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. These severe storms will be near... Mechanicsville, Hanover and East Highland Park around 1100 AM EDT. Bensley and Studley around 1105 AM EDT. Highland Springs around 1110 AM EDT. Manquin around 1120 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Enfield, Central Garage, Richmond Heights, Hanover Airport, Midlothian, Elmont, Etna Mills, Short Pump, Montrose and Longdale. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
